summary: In this context, sulfur dioxide is not directly mentioned in relation to 1-propanol. The focus is on the production of various higher alcohols, including 1-propanol, during the fermentation of wines by different strains of S. cerevisiae. While sulfur dioxide is commonly used in winemaking as a preservative and antioxidant, its specific interaction with 1-propanol or its influence on its production is not discussed in the provided text.
